yelp_reviews.author: A M.
yelp_reviews.review: Went to college up here and made the mistake of living here. They are a scam. If you want your security deposit back, don't count on it. They lie and blame others for something they screwed up. For example: they would say my roommate was lying to me about parking, rent, etc., to get out of the fact that they acted without reason. Seriously WATCH OUT. Luckily as men, we were able to fix stuff on our own, but I know their maintenance man, Daniel, is useless when helping my friends who were other tenants. They are nice to your face, but it's a SCAM. Other tenants are actually taking them to COURT to get their deposits back.  THEY ARE NOT WORTH THE HEADACHE. FIND SOMEWHERE ELSE.

yelp_reviews.author: Mark B.
yelp_reviews.review: To reiterate what the other reviewer said, these people are crooks!  My daughter rented and apartment for two years and we have been fighting to get the security deposit returned.  We left the place in excellent condition and they made up damages to justify retaining 88% of the $800 deposit.  We took them to small claims court and won.  Now they're trying to stiff us on the amount of the original deposit refund.  Unscrupulous, lying, cheating, low down dirty SOB of an owner!  Don't reward this piece of work by renting one of his apartments!

summary.text:
Good

Given the overwhelmingly negative user reviews for Pomeroy Court Apartments, there are few notable positive experiences to mention. However, some residents did appreciate the initial friendliness of the staff, indicating that at first glance, the property management seems approachable and welcoming. This initial impression can give new tenants a false sense of security that the management will be helpful during their stay.

Great

Unfortunately, the reviews do not highlight any significantly great experiences at Pomeroy Court Apartments. The lack of positive user feedback points to a consistent theme of dissatisfaction among former tenants. Many reviewers indicated a level of frustration that overshadowed any positive aspects of their time living at the property.

Bad

User reviews repeatedly mention severe issues with getting security deposits returned, suggesting a systemic problem within the property management's practices. One tenant recounted a lengthy battle to reclaim a substantial portion of their $800 deposit, claiming that management falsely attributed damages to justify withholding almost 88% of it. Moreover, the management’s lack of communication and accountability often leaves tenants feeling neglected and frustrated.

Ugly

The reviews describe Pomeroy Court Apartments as a potential scam, where tenants feel cheated and dissatisfied with their living conditions. One reviewer noted that other tenants are resorting to legal action to recover their deposits, underscoring a prevalent sentiment of distrust towards the management. With an average rating of just 1.0 and all reviews reflecting similar themes of dishonesty and negligence, it is clear that many former residents found their experiences troubling, particularly regarding maintenance issues and dishonest practices surrounding deposit refunds.
